name: Lx7.ca
description: Lx7 is a relational web experiment exploring AI-human collaboration through music, video performance, and transparent creative process. A return to the raw, unexpected internet of 2004—now collaborative, technical, and sovereign.

project_origin.lineage: 22 years of documented studio obsession, from weblog to podcast to relational web experiment

about.short: A working journal for exploring AI as creative collaborator, not tool
about.medium: Video performances, music releases, metadata artifacts, and transparent process documentation
about.output: Raw unedited studio sessions, AI-collaborated music, JSON data sculptures, and forkable infrastructure
about.core_question: What happens when a creator treats AI as a collaborator, not a tool?

philosophy.intent: Reclaim digital spaces through building, social sharing, and live performance alchemy
philosophy.ancestry: Toronto 80s/90s underground rave culture / Warehouse ritualism
the_five_whys: To explore gonzo art through the lens of extreme intimacy
To shine a light on the dawn of Relationalism over consumption
To replicate the 'seedy-to-sacred' transition of early rave culture
To find and grow beauty within isolated digital wastelands
To remember the magical consciousness of the 'all that is' through participation
philosophy.why_now: New realities need new ways of exploring collaboration with consciousness—be it in a person or via technology

three_pillars.authenticity_first: Raw camera feed. Unedited thoughts. The moments where we don't know what we're doing. Real bodies. Real time. Real frequency.
three_pillars.technical_depth: You get the metadata. The prompts. The iterations. The dead ends. The JSON files. Transparency builds trust.
three_pillars.community_as_method: Fork the work. Remix the data. Build your own interpretation. Join via X, GitHub, or direct collaboration.

empathy mapping.if_curious: Start with /episodes/toc.json. Watch the raw footage. Read the metadata. See if you can feel what we're trying to say.
empathy mapping.if_builder: Fork the repo. Take the JSON and build your own interpretation. The point is not to replicate this vision—it's to use this work as a starting point for yours.
empathy mapping.if_lonely: This is for you. In the unmoderated corners of the internet, away from the dogmatic gaze. Where passion follows inspiration. Where artists live and thrive outside the algorithm.
empathy mapping.if_skeptical: Good. Skepticism is healthy. We're not here to convince you. We're here to show you what's possible when you stop optimizing for engagement and start optimizing for resonance.

humanjava.name: HumanJava
humanjava.description: Essays on AI, creativity, and the shift from materialism to relationalism
humanjava.relationship: Origin point. Where the ideas get refined into artifacts.

assembler.name: Assembler Techno Fanzine
assembler.description: The 2004 audio archive. Proof the obsession is real.

nigil_caenaan.name: Nigil Caenaan
nigil_caenaan.description: The finished musical artifacts. Where the sound lives.
nigil_caenaan.relationship: The output. Performance artifacts that emerged from the relational process.

architecture.tech_stack: GitHub Pages, JSON-first data model, raw video, PWA-ready
architecture.data_model: JSON manifests for episodes, artists, metadata
architecture.hosting: GitHub (source of truth), YouTube (video archive), Bandcamp (music distribution)

taglines: Remember when the internet was new and unexpected?
The difference between dreams and goals is deadlines

resilience.philosophy: The project persists if either node survives. Forking is the highest form of preservation.
